value.name: How A Recession And By-Election Misery Sent Rishi Sunak Back To Square One
value.description: Added to the 0.1% contraction in the three months before, it means the country was officially in recession – the very thing the prime minister had promised would not happen. Then, in the early hours of Friday morning, the Tories lost two by-elections to Labour in previously-safe seats.

value.description: And if they are defeated in both Wellingborough and Kingswood, it would be the third time that two by-elections have been lost on the same day during Rishi Sunak’s premiership. The Tory majority in Kingswood is 11,200, while Wellingborough has a majority of 18,540.

value.name: Michael Marra defends Labour's energy sector windfall tax plan
value.description: Jenny Stanning, external relations director at OEUK, said she was “disappointed” with Labour’s windfall tax plan and the lack of engagement from the UK party on the issues, but added that she welcomed the bridges that the Scottish Labour Party is currently attempting to build with the industry.

value.name: Worst of Westminster: Tories finished and muted Labour celebrations
value.description: This UK Government has now seen the most by-election losses of any Conservative administration since the Second World War. In Wellingborough, the figures were stark as Labour’s Gen Kitchen overturned a majority of more than 18,000 with a swing of 28.5% - the second highest of all time.

value.name: Labour will make Scotland the ‘clean energy capital of UK’
value.description: DELEGATES to Scottish Labour’s business conference in Glasgow were assured today that the next Labour government will make Scotland the “clean energy capital” of Britain. The claim was made by shadow net zero secretary Ed Miliband as he discussed the party’s green prosperity plan alongside his Holyrood counterpart, Sarah Boyack.

value.name: Labour urged to be ‘bold’ after double by-election wins
value.description: LABOUR was urged to be “bold” after flipping major Tory majorities in the Wellingborough and Kingswood by-elections today. Sir Keir Starmer said the results showed people were “crying out for change” and that his party were “now credible contenders” for this year’s general election.

value.name: Plan for new East Belfast apartment block causes split at City Hall
value.description: A new four storey apartment block has been approved for East Belfast despite local objections and a split in Belfast Council. At the recent Belfast City Council Planning Committee meeting, elected representatives went to a vote before passing an application for the erection of a 16 unit apartment building at 215-225 Castlereagh Road, BT5.

value.description: Anas Sarwar tells the Scottish Labour conference that his party has more ambition for Scotland than the SNP or Tories.

value.description: There has been some easing of the farm protests in Europe, at least in part because of a sense the case being made is now commanding political attention. Europe is not alone with farmer frustration, with reports that Indian farmers had to be faced down with tear gas.

value.name: Wellingborough and Kingswood by-elections: Job not done despite huge wins, says Starmer
value.description: The party came third in both by-elections, picking up 13% of the vote in Wellingborough and 10.4% in Kingswood. Labour secured a majority of 2,501 over Tory candidate Sam Bromiley in the South Gloucestershire seat of Kingswood, near Bristol.
